messages.body:
ATTN;
I am Hajia Maryam Abacha, widow of the Late Gen. Sani Abacha former
Nigerian Military Head of State who died as a result of cardiac
arrest.
I therefore decided to contact you in confidence so that I can
be able to move out the sum of US$35,760,000.00 ( Thirty Five Million
Seven hundred and Sixty Thousand U. S. Dollars ) which was secretly
defaced and seal in big metal box for security reasons in your account.
I personally therefore appeal to you for your urgent assistance
to move this money into your country where I believe it will be
safe since I cannot leave the country due to the restriction of
movement imposed on me and members of my family by the Nigerian
government.
You can contact me through, or my family lawyer . Upon the receipt
of your acceptance to assist me, my lawyer shall arrange with you
for a face to face meeting
outside Nigeria in order to liaise with him towards the effective
completion of this transaction.
However, arrangement has been put in place to move this money
out of the country in batches in a secret vault through a diplomatic
security company to any of the European country as soon as you indicate
your interest. I also want you to be assured that all necessary
arrangement for the hitch-free of this transaction has been concluded.
Conclusively, I have decided to offer you 25% of the total sum
5% will be for whatever expenses that will be incurred, while 70%
is to be used in buying share in your company subsequent to our
free movement by the Nigerian government.
Please reply urgently and treat with absolute confidentiality
and sincerity.

Best regards,

HAJIA Maryam.
ABACHAc/o Ba

messages.body:
From the office of:
Mr. Stuart Fielding
Managing Director: Flash Mob Designs Inc.
London W4
United Kingdom

Thank you for your email.
I am very interested in your proposition as I am always looking
for further investment opportunities. However unless you are able
to come to meet with me in the UK then you will have to provide
me with some guaranteed proof of identity before I am prepared to
proceed any further. I am afraid that a passport or other ID will
not be suitable as I know how easily such things are forged.
I am sorry if I appear rude to you, this is not my intention, but
when it comes to matters of serious business I do not have time
for niceties. I am by nature a friendly and generous man, but where
business is involved you will find me deliberate and serious.
First a little information about myself and my company. My Name
is Stuart Fielding and I have been working in this industry for
eighteen years. My company is called Flash Mob Designs Inc. We are
a design company responsible for the design of all types of electronic
and electrical appliances ranging from men's shavers, to mobile
phones and music systems, right up to motor car designs. Our annual
profits are around £8.4 million UK pounds per year, and I
employ just over 200 employees.
To return to your proposition. As I have indicated, I am very interested
in your proposition, but before I would be willing to proceed or
give out any private information I will require that you are able
to send be some definite proof of your identity. May I suggest the
following: That we agree on a password phrase, and then you get
a new photograph of yourself holding a sign with the password written
on it? That way I will know for certain that the person in the picture
is you.
I am happy to help you financially in this respect if needed, but
first you will have to prove your identity to me. I am afraid that
without proof of your identity I will be unwilling to proceed. My
terms above are absolutely non negotiable.
Again, I urge you to read the above carefully before replying to
this email. I do not want to appear rude but being such a busy person
I cannot afford to have my time wasted by people who do not read
my emails correctly.
Thank you again for your email.

Mr. Stuart Fielding
Managing Director: Flash Mob Designs Inc.

Dear Mrs. Abacha,
Thank you for your email.
Once I am in receipt of your photograph in the manner described
below, I will immediately contact your lawyer to initiate the start
of this deal.

The most important aspect of this deal for me presently is to be
100% trusting in my prospective partner, which is why I wish to
be so careful about the photograph. In my experience, absolute trust
in you partner always guarantees a fast and beneficial outcome.
I require a new photograph of yourself, holding a sign or poster
containing some kind of object/password which only I have told you
about. The reason I ask for this is so that I can be sure that the
person in the photograph is indeed yourself, then I will be able
to trust you fully in this deal. With regards to the completion
of this deal, once your photograph has been received I am available
IMMEDIATELY to proceed.
Now to the matter of your identification, I suggest that of course
a password phrase associated with my company would be one that is
best to use, do to aid you I have attached a image of the password
phrase to this email.

Please print out the attachment as large and clear as you can, then
hold it up and have your photograph taken holding it. When I receive
a satisfactory photograph I will then be 100% trusting in you and
will be happy to proceed with this deal with the utmost urgency.

Please note, this is VERY important: The image must be very large
and clear. I am afraid I cannot accept small or unclear images.
IF THE IMAGE YOU SEND TO ME IS SMALL I WILL REJECT IT. Please do
not waste your valuable time by sending me a inadequate image because
I will reject it immediately.
Once I receive a satisfactory image I will contact you, and if
necessary I will be happy to supply my identification also. Please
let me know on what day you will be able to send the picture and
I will ensure that I am in my office so that I may contact you immediately.
I am ready to proceed with this deal immediately your image is
received.
Below you will find detailed instructions on how to scan the photograph
correctly if you need them. PLEASE take note of them carefully as
I WILL reject any small or unsuitable images.

Again I must stress to you the importance of a large clear image.
Please do not delay our progress by sending me an inadequate image.
Kind regards,

Stuart Fielding

messages.body:
Dear Maryam,

Whilst I must thank you for the picture, I am afraid I am going
to have to reject it. My reasons:

Although the content of the picture is correct, and the size of
the picture is correct, the person who has scanned the picture for
you has use too much JPEG compression. This has made the picture
very blurry and blocky. For instance, look at your face in the picture.
It is made very unclear by blocky squares and blurring.

Of course I realise that this is not your fault, it is the fault
of the person who scanned the image. Please tell the person who
scanned the image to scan it again but DO NOT use any jpeg compression.

Once I receive a clearer version of the picture I will be ready
to forge ahead.

Kind regards,

Stuart Fielding.

Dear Maryam,

Whilst I must thank you for the picture, I am afraid I am going to have to reject it. My reasons:

Although the content of the picture is correct, and the size of the picture is correct, the person who has scanned the picture for you has use too much JPEG compression. This has made the picture very blurry and blocky. For instance, look at your face in the picture. It is made very unclear by blocky squares and blurring.

Of course I realise that this is not your fault, it is the fault of the person who scanned the image. Please tell the person who scanned the image to scan it again but DO NOT use any jpeg compression.

Once I receive a clearer version of the picture I will be ready to forge ahead.

Kind regards,

Stuart Fielding.

messages.body:
Dear Mariam,
Hello me old mucker, and how are you today?
OK, please find attached my picture which was taken a short while
ago at the fancy dress party. My apologies for the disheveled look
of myself and my friends. I am afraid I had just a little too much
to drink. The people on the photograph are (from left to right)
Dick Hertz, Paige Turner, Moe Lester, and of course myself, Stuart
Fielding.
Now that we have got these formalities out of the way, I sure am
hoping we can get on with the business in hand. Please let me know
what you need from me so that we can proceed quickly.
I would like you to note that we are now in Tribble hunting season
here in the UK, so there may be some delay in some of my replies.
I don't know about you, but I for one just can't shoot enough of
the little buggers.
Looking forward to your next email.
Stuart.

messages.body:
Hello
Mariam,


No,
the Mogwai cannot fly, but it is a very good swimmer and also can
be very easily trained as it is an exceptionally intelligent animal.
My own Mogwai, Scabby can even juggle small Tribbles.  Such
fun to watch him happily sit in a corner juggling away!

Sadly
it looks like you do not have them in your country. This is a great
shame as I was wanting to purchase 10-20 of these lovely creatures.
However, I am also looking for Iguana's and Chameleons also.
I am willing to pay $800 each for Iguana's and $350 each for Chameleons.
If you are able to arrange an export of these creatures please do
let me know.

Please
let me know the news from the security company also.


Take
care.
Stuart.
messages.raw:
From: Stuart Fielding
To: Mariam Abacha

Hello Mariam,

 
No, the Mogwai cannot fly, but it is a very good swimmer and also can be very easily trained as it is an exceptionally intelligent animal.  My own Mogwai, Scabby can even juggle small Tribbles.  Such fun to watch him happily sit in a corner juggling away! 
 
Sadly it looks like you do not have them in your country. This is a great shame as I was wanting to purchase 10-20 of these lovely creatures.  However, I am also looking for Iguana's and Chameleons also.  I am willing to pay $800 each for Iguana's and $350 each for Chameleons.  If you are able to arrange an export of these creatures please do let me know.
 
Please let me know the news from the security company also.
 

Take care.

Stuart.

messages.body:
Dear Mariam,
Please rest assured that I know this "is not a game"
as you so eloquently put it. It was just that I did not understand
the word "dumorage" as there does not seem to be a word
in the entire English language like that. The closest we have is
"domorage" which means, '"to spank with a wet lettuce",
so of course I though it was time to don the rubber suit (again).
My apologies if you misunderstood.
Now that you have explained I can tell you that the English word
you mean is in fact "demurrage". Of course I understand
about demurrage fees, they are used a lot here in the UK. Again,
apologies for the misunderstanding which of course I understand
is probably because you spell things differently over there.
Anyway, thanks for the info and I look forward to hearing from
you again soon.
Stuart.

messages.body:
Dear Mariam,
What money are you expecting me to send to you? When you mentioned
payment last time you wrote "THEY WILL CHARGE ME US$1,100
DOLLARS PER YEAR". So, they are charging YOU, not me.
Are you expecting me to pay this fee? How much is this fee in total?
When does it have to be paid? Why does it have to be paid? Who is
the payment to be made out to? In what form will the payment be
made? What will happen after the payment is made? Will this be the
only payment required? What is the annual percentage rate of the
clearance tax? Is it a one-off payment? Who shot JR?
You never told me at any point that I would be expected to pay
any fees Mariam. Please explain yourself.
With regards to the chameleons, please tell the brave hunters that
once I have seen the export certificate for the chameleons I will
be happy to pay the mobilisation fees. I need to make sure that
you are able to get a Chameleon Export License before I send any
payment. Please arrange this export license and then attach a scan
of the license for me to see. Once I have seen the license I will
make plans to send the brave hunters the mobilisation fees.
Laterz,
Stuart.

messages.body:
Dear Mariam,
My apologies for the late reply but I have been in Scotland on
a very important business deal. In fact I have managed to secure
a contract with McTavish Mobile Systems to design and manufacture
their new range of mobile/cell phones. I am extremely happy about
this as we have been in contract discussions for the past 3 months.
The contract is worth UK £3.7 million pounds per year to us,
so as you can understand I am extremely excited about this.
With regards to the demurrage fees you mention, of course $7,700
is not a lot of money to me, but before I am willing to proceed
I need to ask some questions, and I need you to take great care
with the answers to make sure they are accurate. Here are my questions:
1. Can you tell me if this is the ONLY fee that will be required?
If you can foresee any more fees, please can you ask the security
company to try to tell me the COMPLETE and TOTAL amount required
in order to transfer these funds.
2. What guarantee can you offer me that this fund really exists,
and what guarantees can you give me that if I send the full fees
that you will not do anything dishonest with my money.
I shall await your urgent reply. In the meantime, I'm of to celebrate
my new contract and get pissed out of my brains.
Laterz,
Stuart Fielding.
Managing Director: Flash Mob Designs Inc.

messages.body:
From the office of:
Mr. Stuart Fielding
Managing Director: Flash Mob Designs Inc.
London W4
United Kingdom
Dear Mariam,
Thank you for your quick response. Thank you also for attaching
the deposit certificate.

However, despite what you have told me, I am still unhappy about
sending you the $7,700. Please understand, $7,700 is not a lot of
money to me, but of course I do realise that to most people it is
a LOT of money. If I decide to send this money to you then I am
indeed putting a GREAT amount of TRUST in you that you will not
steal my money, and I do not know if I am ready to do that yet.
However, I do have a suggestion to make that will make me trust
you 100% and therefore be willing to send you the SEVEN THOUSAND
SEVEN HUNDRED DOLLARS.

Again, I am putting an enormous amount of trust in you Mariam, so
now I think that you must prove yourself to me by doing the same.
Here is my suggestion:

You show your TRUST in me by sending me $200 (Two Hundred dollars)
in cash by courier (DHL/FedEx etc.). When I receive your $200 TOKEN
OF TRUST, then I will promise to do the following:

1. On receipt of your $200 I will IMMEDIATELY forward you the $7,700,
PLUS your $200. I will return you $200 immediately as it is not
the money that is important to me, it is the trust.

2. I will also promise to give you financial backing if further
payments are required.

As an experienced and wealthy businessman, I do of course realise
that the transfers of such large amounts of money will probably
require further processing fees. If you send me the $200 token of
trust then I am willing to fund this transfer to the maximum amount
of $25,000 (twenty five thousand dollars) and the condition that
I can deduct this amount from the fees after the fund has been transferred.

I consider my offer extremely fair considering the large amount
of money you are requiring me to send to you. Again, your $200 WILL
be returned to you will the $7,700 payment (so I will send you a
total of SEVEN THOUSAND NINE HUNDRED DOLLARS).

Also, if your hunter is able to get the chameleons I will also send
they payment for them at the same time.

Let me know your thoughts.

Stuart Fielding.
Managing Director: Flash Mob Designs Inc.

messages.body:
Dear Mariam,

I have a friend who works for DHL and I have spoken to him about
sending cash. He has told me that their customers do it all the
time, and in fact it does happen a lot from Nigeria also. Of course
he told me that normally it is not recommended but he told me the
best and safest way to send cash is to put it into something like
a birthday card, then mark the contents as "contract documents".

In fact I have sent cash by DHL myself on many occasions. I sent
cash to my cousin who lives in Nairobi, Kenya, and there were no
problems at all.

I am sorry Mariam, but before I am prepared to send you a VERY LARGE
sum such as $7,700 then you must send me this token of trust.

If you are unwilling to send this money Mariam, please tell me NOW,
so that we can finish this deal here and now. I am not prepared
to take the risk of sending $7,700 unless you are prepared to accept
the same risk.

If your answer is "no" then I am afraid this is the end
of the deal.

Sincerely,

Mr. Stuart Fielding
Managing Director: Flash Mob Designs Inc.

Well, it looks like Mariam has given up on me! It's almost two weeks since her last email. I knew asking for $200 was going just a little bit too far, but as my mum used to say, "If you don't ask, you don't get".
Not to worry, there are many thousands of Mariam Abacha's still out there, and at least she was kind enough to post me her photograph
